title: Does this mouse issue sound familiar to anyone?
body:
I have been having some lag issues with my mouse while playing League as of late. It only happens with League that I'm noticing. Here's what happening:

I will click to move, and I'll see the arrows at the click zone. However, I do not move. I check my fps and my ping, and neither are out of the norm. It'll continue anywhere from .25 seconds to 2 seconds, then I'll start moving to the most recent destination. This issue wasn't a problem until shortly after I downloaded the client a few weeks ago. It happens very sporadically, sometimes as often as 3 times in a single minute, then never again all game. Doesn't happen every game, but usually happens at least once.

Does this sound familiar at all?

I'm using a Logitech G602, which is wireless. The adapter is inches away from the mouse, pointing straight at it. Brand new batteries, replaced the moment I started getting the issue. Haven't had problems until the past two weeks or so.

replies.body:
It sounds like what you're experiencing is more along the lines of a network connection issue such as *Packet Loss* than it does a mouse problem. These issues happen if there's something between your PC and our servers that causes an *instability* between the two. Our [**connection guide**](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues) will run you through the most common network configurations that end up causing issues for League.

If you happen to still have issues in-game after you've worked through the guide, let me know.

I tried to use the Netalyzer suggested under Packet Loss, but Java says it has an outdated certificate and won't start it.

I did the IP renew and DNS flush. I'll see if that helped, at least.

You may be able to get the Netalyzr to work if you try another web browser and [update your java definitions](https://java.com/en/download/).

I hope this worked!
I did both of those things first off. Still didn't want to start.
Gotcha. I wouldn't worry about the Netalyzr at the moment, then. Did any of your symptoms in-game change?
I haven't had a problem really over the past two weeks. I don't know EXACTLY what did it, but one of the suggested tricks seems to have worked. I think it was the ISP refresh.
